answerText: Knut Hamsun[10] Hamsun's Nobel Prize in Literature was due in large part to this 1917 prose epic about the struggles of the farmers Isak and Inger.
heading: MAGNI |2011 | 1 | 7 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Lieutenant Glahn is the protagonist of this author's Pan. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Norwegian author of Hunger, whose posthumous reputation went into great decline because of his support for the Nazis.
